title: Anaphylaxis - 6-year-old - Stage 1
content: Medical management for Anaphylaxis - Stage 1: Recognition & ABCs. Required interventions: Placement in resuscitation, Exam including airway and lung assessment, Placement on cardiovascular monitoring, IM epinephrine given.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 1: Anaphylaxis

title: Anaphylaxis - 6-year-old - Stage 2
content: Medical management for Anaphylaxis - Stage 2: Stabilization & Monitoring. Required interventions: IV fluids, steroids, H2 blocker, diphenhydramine, nebulized albuterol.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 1: Anaphylaxis

title: Anaphylaxis - 6-year-old - Stage 3
content: Medical management for Anaphylaxis - Stage 3: Observation & Prevention. Required interventions: Discussion around need for admission, Discussion with family about anaphylaxis/allergic reactions, Outpatient treatment and follow up discussion.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 1: Anaphylaxis

title: Anaphylaxis - 6-year-old
content: A 6-year-old boy brought in by car with a parent presents with difficulty breathing, vomiting, rash, and facial swelling after eating at a restaurant. He has no previous allergic reactions. The child should be quickly moved to a resuscitation area, placed on a cardiac monitor and given IM epinephrine. If IM epinephrine is administered quickly, he should show some improvement in a few minutes, but not completely resolved. If not promptly administered, he will become hypotensive and lethargic. Ideally, he should receive IV steroids, IV fluids, diphenhydramine, H2 blocker, and nebulizer on arrival. If all medications are administered, he will recover appropriately. If epinephrine is not given early, he will progress to hypotension and shock and need IV epinephrine infusion. There is an optional more difficult pathway for advanced learners where the initial IM epinephrine is not fully effective and the patient worsens, eventually needing multiple medications and an infusion of epinephrine.
presenting_symptoms: Facial swelling, Difficulty breathing, Wheezing, Hypotension, Tachycardia, Urticaria, Anxiety, Nausea
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 1: Anaphylaxis

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 1
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 1: Initial Stabilization. Required interventions: Recognize respiratory distress, Obtain complete vital signs, Place on supplemental oxygen, Obtain focused history, Perform focused physical exam.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 2
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 2: Early Workup & Reassessment. Required interventions: Recognize abnormal physical exam findings, Formulate a broad, life-threatening differential, Order STAT portable CXR, Order STAT ECG, Order appropriate blood tests.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 3
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 3: Interpret Early Diagnostics. Required interventions: Identify cardiomegaly on CXR, Recognize low voltage and electrical alternans on ECG, Interpret blood test results correctly.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 4
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 4: Point-of-Care Ultrasound. Required interventions: Perform bedside point-of-care ultrasound (heart/IVC), Recognize large pericardial effusion, Recognize sonographic signs of tamponade.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 5
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 5: Definitive Intervention Pathway. Required interventions: Recognize need for emergent pericardiocentesis, Perform bedside pericardiocentesis under ultrasound guidance, Call interventional cardiology / CT surgery.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 6
content: Medical management for Cardiac Tamponade - Stage 6: Disposition & Communication. Required interventions: Discuss with pediatric intensivist, Transfer patient to the PICU, Update the family and provide handoff.
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics - Clinical Stages
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade

title: Cardiac Tamponade
content: Pediatric patient in respiratory distress with hypotension, tachycardia, hypoxia, and fever; exam notable for JVD and distant heart sounds—concern for pericardial effusion/tamponade.
presenting_symptoms: Respiratory distress, Hypotension, Tachycardia, Hypoxia, Fever, JVD, Distant heart sounds
source: ALiEM EM ReSCu Pediatrics
citation: ALiEM EM ReSCu Peds – Case 2: Cardiac Tamponade
